result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Kristopher G Hansen was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Per Statute 343.301(g) your operating privileges for operation of Class D vehicles will require that vehicles owned and/or driven by you be equipped with an ignition interlock device.  Must install a mandatory Ignition Interlock Device when defendant obtains an occupational license or regular license.  There is a $50 ignition interlock surcharge imposed.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and a driver safety plan.  You must also comply with any recommendations.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Must comply with any other recommendations of your agent for counseling/programming.

Must wear a SCRAM unit for 1 year after release from the 90 days jail term.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Must pay resitution for the costs of the blood test done by the Jackson County Sheriff's Department.  Failure to pay the restitution in full may result in a money judgment being entered against you.

timeConds.notes: Conditional jail time to begin on or before March 1, 2016 with 4 days sentence credit granted.  May serve on EMP according to jail rules and may serve in Vernon County if arrangements can be made.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Request for Legal Blood Draw Reimbursement from JASO - $69.00

Defendant Kristopher G Hansen in court with attorney Carly June Sebion and James Ritland.  Gerald Roger Fox appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA Fox states there is a joint recommendation:  Defendant will plead to Count 1 in 14CF90 and Count 1 in 15CF66.  Recommendation for sentencing is:  3 years probation concurrent on both cases with 90 days conditional jail on 14CF90 and with 4 days sentence credit; may serve on EMP and in Vernon County if arrangements can be made; To be on SCRAM for 1 year after conditional jail has been served; may report to jail on or before March 1, 2016.  Additional sentence on 14CF90 - $600 fine plus costs; $69 restitution to Jackson County Jail for blood test costs; alcohol assessment and DSP; DL revocation of 24 months and IID 24 months.  Will plea to Count 1 in 14CF90; Count 15CF66.  There is joint recommendation of probation 3 years on both with conditions of Probation:  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Court performs plea colloquy/reviews waiver of rights/elements.  Attorney Ritland stipulates to the factual basis in the complaint in 14CF90; attorney Sebion stipulates to the factual basis in the complaint in 15CF66.  Defendant admits to 3 prior convictions for OWI/PAC.  Court finds defendant understands the proceedings, he freely voluntarily entered his plea and waived his rights; Court accepts his pleas and finds him guilty.  Court performs plea colloquy/reviews rights/elements with defendant.  Court finds he freely and voluntarily enters his plea/waives his rights and finds him guilty of Count 1 - 14CF90 and Count 1 - 15CF66;  Case 15CF112 is dismissed and read-in; Count 2 in 14CF90 is dismissed and read-in, and Count 3 is dismissed outright; 14TR2043 - Refusal is found reasonable and is dismissed.  Court accepts the sentencing recommendation as stated.  9 months jail to begin on or before 3/1/16 by 6:00 with credit for 4 days served; all other recommendations ordered as stated, plus a DNA sample to be submitted on 15CF66 plus pay the surcharge; surcharge also on 15CF66 and to pay the court costs.
Mailed a copy to Family & Children's Center in Viroqua

Jury trial February 5, 2016
Final PTC on January 8, 2016 at 9:00

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  AMENDED 6-09-14:  Must report to Jackson County Sheriff's Office or any local law enforcement agency where you live for the random testing.
